item.title: Blanc-arita
item.description: 2 oz silver tequila½ oz blanc vermouth½ oz lime juice½ oz agave syrup1 dash orange bitters Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

item.title: Vigo
item.description: I didn’t invent this drink, but I did invent the name. 2 oz orange juice1 oz London dry gin1 oz blanc vermouth¼ oz honey syrup2 oz sparkling wine Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake then strain into a wine glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Be disappointed by Mimosas for the rest of your life.

item.title: Martini
item.description: Everyone has an opinion about martinis. I’ll spare you mine, and just give you my recipe. Trust me. I often use a blanc vermouth instead of the traditional dry, but it’s delicious with either. Any type of gin works in a martini, but I prefer a sweeter style. 2¼ oz genever gin¾ oz dry vermouth Add to cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Stir well, then strain into a martini glass.
